subject: Wrap text in sample configuration files at 80

values.-1: This patch needs further work before it can be merged
values.+1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

messages.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This makes sense.

I thought I had seen a patch to change the default in oslo itself, but I can't find anything ... I must've seen a different project doing the same thing you're doing here.

Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Thanks for the review, Brian!

Erno mentioned that this could potentially reorganize the config opts in the sample files. Although config generator got a bug fix for constantly reordering the opts in sample files, we are not completely sure. So, I'm going to regenerate the sample configs with this change and check if that reorders anything.

Alternatively, I'll get a patch up for generating the sample configs as part of our docs so that we can get rid our sample config files from the code tree.

Until then, I'm going to -w this.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I am all for generating the sample files as part of the documentation. The current generate-and-commit workflow is not a good developer experience.

Patch Set 1:

Here is the patch for generating sample config with docs.
https://review.openstack.org/313974
Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.

Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

This won't fit properly to the docs site div[0], if we are planning to use that.

[0] http://docs-draft.openstack.org/74/313974/4/check/gate-glance-docs/941f248//doc/build/html/sample-configuration.html

Patch Set 2:

> This won't fit properly to the docs site div[0], if we are planning
 > to use that.
 > 
 > [0] http://docs-draft.openstack.org/74/313974/4/check/gate-glance-docs/941f248//doc/build/html/sample-configuration.html

Erno,
Can you elaborate on your comment please?
Maybe I'm missing something, but I don't see anything wrong in how that page renders. The sample config file mostly wraps as desired excepting the values for some config opts that go beyond 80 chars. And, those can't be wrapped understandably. Is that what you are hinting at?

Also, maybe we should refrain from displaying the sample file on that page. Just include the links to sample files maybe. The sample config page is too long to scroll and it's hard to realize that it contains multiple sample files.

recheck

Well I don't see the output anymore at all in the docs page. Could have pulled screenshot for you.

Patch Set 3:

The old link still works. Search for logging_user_identity_format for example.that line clips out (first ~300 lines of the that page does not).

Patch Set 3:

Erno, Please correct me if I am wrong. 
The line that you are referring to hasn't been clipped out. The doc generation has accommodated it. It requires us to scroll through. 

Wrapping width to 80 would help align help texts to be in accordance with code.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

recheck -- the doc gate needs refresh to understand the issue a bit more

Patch Set 3:

@Erno: sorry to be so dense, but I am still trying to understand your objection.  Are you referring to something like this:

http://docs-draft.openstack.org/87/343887/3/check/gate-glance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/2459172//doc/build/html/opts/glance_api.html#DEFAULT.default_log_levels

where the default option value is so long that you have to scroll horizontally to see it?

Patch Set 3:

> @Erno: sorry to be so dense, but I am still trying to understand
 > your objection.  Are you referring to something like this:
 > 
 > http://docs-draft.openstack.org/87/343887/3/check/gate-glance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/2459172//doc/build/html/opts/glance_api.html#DEFAULT.default_log_levels
 > 
 > where the default option value is so long that you have to scroll
 > horizontally to see it?

+1, I have the same question.

If this issue is specifically with the docs page/site and assuming it isn't a trivial issue, we can alternatively choose not to publish the sample configs in literal text. We can just include the links to text files, which I don't believe suffer from bad formatting that we are talking about here.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

> > @Erno: sorry to be so dense, but I am still trying to understand
 > > your objection.  Are you referring to something like this:
 > >
 > > http://docs-draft.openstack.org/87/343887/3/check/gate-glance-docs-ubuntu-xenial/2459172//doc/build/html/opts/glance_api.html#DEFAULT.default_log_levels
 > >
 > > where the default option value is so long that you have to scroll
 > > horizontally to see it?
 > 
 > +1, I have the same question.
 > 
 > If this issue is specifically with the docs page/site and assuming
 > it isn't a trivial issue, we can alternatively choose not to
 > publish the sample configs in literal text. We can just include the
 > links to text files, which I don't believe suffer from bad
 > formatting that we are talking about here.

I kinda like the docs page much much better than the plain text files. The deprectaions, defaults etc. are so much more visible on the html page.

If we are going to get rid of the config files, I think it's worthy that we build the stable and master out of the docs gate. This way we don't need to have another gate that does the auto update the files.


Having said that, I am totally unsure of what is the appropriate wrap for the text. I would like to learn where exactly the usability issue persists.


Would love to see this move forward. Thanks much!

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Yes I didn't realize that the pain was caused by configgenerator not wrapping the default values at all. This is not optimal solution, but not gonna block it.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

Let's get this merged ASAP as it will help with the weird wrapping situation on some of the other help text improvement patches.

If anyone feels sufficiently strongly about it, a bug could be filed with the docs team about improving the display of default values in the HTML rendering.

Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Let's get this merged ASAP as it will help with the weird wrapping
 > situation on some of the other help text improvement patches.
 > 
 > If anyone feels sufficiently strongly about it, a bug could be
 > filed with the docs team about improving the display of default
 > values in the HTML rendering.


+1 for bug to doc team
